page.title: 01Introduction
page.content: The area is in Buckinghamshire, mainly on the Chiltern escarpment, 600-700 feet above sea-level. It is virtually the parish of The Lee, population approx 500 adults. The main residential area is Lee Common, as building has been contained since 1850. With the advent of personal transport together with the railway line to London nearby, The Lee is now largely a commuter area for London. The Block is entirely within the Chiltern A.O.N.B., & is crossed by the Ivinghoe-Avebury Ridgeway Path. It is a rural area, with considerable farmland & about 30% woodland. A large portion of the land is still owned & farmed by the Stewart-Liberty family, who bought the manor in the late 19th century, though several farms & most of the houses have since been sold.
